page.title: 01THE WATER SLIDE, RICHMOND
page.content: The building of {wild waters}was started in February 1984 and it was opened at Easter 1985.They chose to build it in Richmond because it is quite a rich area and they thought people might have enough money to go on it.It costs Â£2.50 for a 40 minute session.Wild waters is the{largest } {enclosed water slide in Europe.}There are four flumes altogether.Their names are Aquajet,Corkscrew,Twister and Black-Hole.They choose scary names for them because they are sort of fun-scary! The flumes are about 100m long and it takes about 40 seconds at the most to go down the slide.You come out into a metre-deep plunging pool.If you have time,you go for another turn. You have to use a mat otherwise you might hurt yourself. The attendant at the top of each slide will tell you exactly what to do!
